info.title: Managed Runtime API
info.description:
Set up how a storefront or other headless commerce application is deployed to Managed Runtime.

Note: Where possible, we changed noninclusive terms to align with our company value of Equality. We maintained certain terms to avoid any effect on customer implementations.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Number of results to return per page.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The initial index from which to return the results.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Number of results to return per page.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The initial index from which to return the results.

post.description: Upload a bundle and deploy it to an environment asynchronously.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Number of results to return per page.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The initial index from which to return the results.

get.description: Get a presigned URL (active for one hour) to download a bundle archive.

parameters.description: Number of results to return per page.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The initial index from which to return the results.

parameters.name: ordering
parameters.description: Which field to use when ordering the results.

parameters.name: role
parameters.description:
* `0` - Admin
* `1` - Developer
* `2` - Marketer
* `3` - Read Only

* `0` - Admin
* `1` - Developer
* `2` - Marketer
* `3` - Read Only

parameters.name: role
parameters.description: A role to filter on. Admin=0, Developer=1, Marketer=2, Read Only=3.

get.description: Read data about a project member's permissions.

parameters.description: Number of results to return per page.

parameters.name: offset

patch.description: Update a target. Important: This endpoint automatically re-deploys the current bundle if any of the SSR-related properties are changed.

get.description: List a target's access control headers.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Number of results to return per page.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The initial index from which to return the results.

parameters.name: ordering
parameters.description: Which field to use when ordering the results.

post.description: Create an access control header to restrict access to an environment so that only trusted traffic coming from your content delivery network (CDN) or development team is allowed. Requests to this environment must contain the header `x-sfdc-access-control` with the value provided or they will be rejected. Accepts an object with a value for a single access control header. See [Access Control Headers](https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/commerce/pwa-kit-managed-runtime/guide/managed-runtime-administration.html?q=access%20control%20header#access-control-headers).

get.description: Read data about an access control header by its id.

delete.description: Delete an access control header by its id.

get.description: Get the deployment history of a target.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Number of results to return per page.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The initial index from which to return the results.

post.description: Deploys a bundle to a target. Returns the status of the deploy. Deployment details are not immediately available in the response as this endpoint is asynchronous. Request the target for progress updates.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Number of results to return per page.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The initial index from which to return the results.

parameters.name: ordering
parameters.description: Which field to use when ordering the results.

patch.description: Create, update, or delete environment variables. Accepts an object with values for single or multiple environment variables. If the variable does not exist, it is created. If the variable exists, it is updated. And if the variable exists and the value is null, it is deleted.

204.description: No response body. The request was processed successfully.

post.description: Invalidate a target's cached objects in the CDN. Cache invalidations are asynchronous and usually complete within two minutes.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Number of results to return per page.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The initial index from which to return the results.

parameters.name: ordering
parameters.description: Which field to use when ordering the results.

post.description: Create one or more redirects. This endpoint accepts either an object with values for a single redirect, or an array of objects for bulk creation. For example, consider a seasonal campaign page for spring. When the spring campaign ends and is replaced with a summer campaign, you can redirect from the spring URL to the summer URL. We recommend that you always create redirects in your staging target (environment) and then [clone](https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/commerce/pwa-kit-managed-runtime/references/mrt-admin?meta=projects_target_redirect_clone_create) them to your production target. This allows you to test the redirects and verify that they work as expected. Changes may take up to 20 minutes to take effect on your site. See [Redirects](https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/commerce/pwa-kit-managed-runtime/guide/managed-runtime-administration.html#redirects).

ResponseExample1-BulkRedirectCreation.value: // No response body. The request was processed successfully.

get.description: Read data about a redirect by `from_path`. See [Redirects](https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/commerce/pwa-kit-managed-runtime/guide/managed-runtime-administration.html#redirects).

patch.description: Update a redirect by `from_path`. For example, you can change a redirect if your content moved or you rebranded with new pages. We recommend that you always change redirects in your staging target (environment), and then [clone](https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/commerce/pwa-kit-managed-runtime/references/mrt-admin?meta=projects_target_redirect_clone_create) the changes to your production target. Changes may take up to 20 minutes to take effect on your site. See [Redirects](https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/commerce/pwa-kit-managed-runtime/guide/managed-runtime-administration.html#redirects).

delete.description: Delete a redirect by `from_path`. For example, you can delete a redirect that's no longer needed because a seasonal campaign is over, you removed a page, or you want to streamline your redirect structure and improve search engine ranking. We recommend that you always delete redirects in your staging target (environment), and then [clone](https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/commerce/pwa-kit-managed-runtime/references/mrt-admin?meta=projects_target_redirect_clone_create) the changes to your production target. Changes may take up to 20 minutes to take effect on your site. When you delete a redirect, you no longer see it in Runtime Admin. See [Redirects](https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/commerce/pwa-kit-managed-runtime/guide/managed-runtime-administration.html#redirects).

204.description: No response body. The request was processed successfully.

post.description: Clone redirects from one target to another. Important: when you clone redirects, you're replacing all the redirects in one target with all the redirects in the other. See [Redirects](https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/commerce/pwa-kit-managed-runtime/guide/managed-runtime-administration.html#redirects).

parameters.name: to_target_slug
parameters.description: The destination target identifier for the clone operation.

post.description: Generate or reset the API key.

get.description: Get email notification preferences for the authenticated user.

patch.description: Update email notification preferences for the authenticated user.

get.description: Get the profile information for the authenticated user.

id.description: Id for this Access Control Header.

value.description: Value to be encrypted. A header value is made up of your chosen set of characters. For the constraints that apply to the value, see [Access Control Headers](https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/commerce/pwa-kit-managed-runtime/guide/managed-runtime-administration.html?q=access%20control%20header#access-control-headers).

ssr_region.title: SSR AWS Region
ssr_region.description:
The default AWS region for newly created targets

* `us-east-1` - US East (N. Virginia)
* `us-east-2` - US East (Ohio)
* `us-west-1` - US West (N. California)
* `us-west-2` - US West (Oregon)
* `ap-south-1` - Asia Pacific (Mumbai)
* `ap-south-2` - Asia Pacific (Hyderabad)
* `ap-northeast-2` - Asia Pacific (Seoul)
* `ap-southeast-1` - Asia Pacific (Singapore)
* `ap-southeast-2` - Asia Pacific (Sydney)
* `ap-southeast-3` - Asia Pacific (Jakarta)
* `ap-northeast-1` - Asia Pacific (Tokyo)
* `ap-northeast-3` - Asia Pacific (Osaka)
* `ca-central-1` - Canada (Central)
* `eu-central-1` - EU (Frankfurt)
* `eu-central-2` - EU (Zurich)
* `eu-west-1` - EU (Ireland)
* `eu-west-2` - EU (London)
* `eu-west-3` - EU (Paris)
* `eu-north-1` - EU (Stockholm)
* `eu-south-1` - EU (Milan)
* `il-central-1` - Israel (Tel Aviv)
* `me-central-1` - Middle East (UAE)
* `sa-east-1` - South America (Sao Paulo)

created_at.description: Timestamp in the extended ISO 8601 format for when the object was created.

updated_at.description: Timestamp in the extended ISO 8601 format for when the object was last updated.

from_path.description: A relative URL. For example, the `from_path` value `/spring` redirects shoppers from the URL `www.example.com/spring`. An asterisk (`*`) at the end of the `from_path` indicates a wildcard. For example, a redirect from `/a/*` matches `/a/`, `/a/b`, and `/a/b/c`.

to_url.description: A relative or absolute URL. For example, the `to_url` value `/summer` redirects shoppers to the URL `www.example.com/summer`.

forward_querystring.description: Some requests contain query string parameters to include in the redirected request. For example, the relative path `/spring-landing-page` can be appended with a query string for analytics tracking, such as `/spring-landing-page?gclid=123`. The `true` value includes query string parameters in the redirect. The `false` value excludes query string parameters from the redirect. The default value is `false`.

forward_wildcard.description: The `true` value automatically includes any path that comes after the wildcard portion of the `from_path` in the `to_url`. For example: if `/a/*` matches `/a/b/c` in the `from_path` and the `to_url` is `/z/`, the redirect URL is `/z/b/c`. The `false` value excludes the wildcard portion. The default value is `false`.

http_status_code.description:
The HTTP status code to be returned in the response. 301 (Moved Permanently) is the recommended and default value. 302 (Found or Moved Temporarily) is another allowable value. For more information about HTTP status codes, see this [status code explainer](https://moz.com/learn/seo/redirection).

* `301` - Permanent 301
* `302` - Temporary 302

publishing_status.description: The status of the redeployment that happens after you call this API. Allowable values: Pending, Completed, Failed. If the request failed, you can [redeploy the environment](https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/commerce/pwa-kit-managed-runtime/guide/pushing-and-deploying-bundles.html) specified in your request.

user_email.title: Email address
user_email.description: Email of the user who created the redirect.

created_at.description: Timestamp in the extended ISO 8601 format for when the object was created.

updated_at.description: Timestamp in the extended ISO 8601 format for when the object was last updated.

updated_by.title: Email address
updated_by.description: Email of the user who last updated the redirect.

APITargetV2Create.description: This is the serializer for target create/list APIs.

state.description:
Target State

* `CREATE_IN_PROGRESS` - Create in Progress
* `PUBLISH_IN_PROGRESS` - Publish in Progress
* `ACTIVE` - Active
* `CREATE_FAILED` - Create Failed
* `PUBLISH_FAILED` - Publish Failed

hostname.description: Hostname (literal or JavaScript regular expression between / characters) on which this target should be loaded by the V8 Tag

ssr_external_hostname.description: Full hostname to used by the environment eg. www.customer.com.

ssr_external_domain.description: The domain to be used for a Universal PWA SSR deployment (e.g. customer.com)

ssr_region.title: SSR AWS Region
ssr_region.description:
The AWS region to which a Universal PWA SSR should be deployed (e.g. us-east-1)

* `us-east-1` - US East (N. Virginia)
* `us-east-2` - US East (Ohio)
* `us-west-1` - US West (N. California)
* `us-west-2` - US West (Oregon)
* `ap-south-1` - Asia Pacific (Mumbai)
* `ap-south-2` - Asia Pacific (Hyderabad)
* `ap-northeast-2` - Asia Pacific (Seoul)
* `ap-southeast-1` - Asia Pacific (Singapore)
* `ap-southeast-2` - Asia Pacific (Sydney)
* `ap-southeast-3` - Asia Pacific (Jakarta)
* `ap-northeast-1` - Asia Pacific (Tokyo)
* `ap-northeast-3` - Asia Pacific (Osaka)
* `ca-central-1` - Canada (Central)
* `eu-central-1` - EU (Frankfurt)
* `eu-central-2` - EU (Zurich)
* `eu-west-1` - EU (Ireland)
* `eu-west-2` - EU (London)
* `eu-west-3` - EU (Paris)
* `eu-north-1` - EU (Stockholm)
* `eu-south-1` - EU (Milan)
* `il-central-1` - Israel (Tel Aviv)
* `me-central-1` - Middle East (UAE)
* `sa-east-1` - South America (Sao Paulo)

ssr_whitelisted_ips.description: Optional space-separated list of IP addresses (CIDR blocks) that can access this target. Leave blank to allow all IPs.

is_production.title: Production
is_production.description: Treat this target as a production environment.

allow_cookies.description: Set true to forward the HTTP cookie header sent by clients to your origin and ensure the Set-Cookie header sent by your app is respected and not stripped.

enable_source_maps.description: Set true to enable source map support. This will set the NODE_OPTIONS environment variable to "--enable-source-maps" in your MRT environment.

log_level.description:
The minimum log level emitted for this target.n
* `TRACE`
* `DEBUG`
* `INFO`
* `WARN`
* `ERROR`
* `FATAL`

pattern.description: Path pattern to invalidate on the CDN. This must start with a forward slash (`/`).

items.description: [Deprecated] Items to invalidate in the application cache.

namespace.description: [Deprecated] Namespace of items to invalidate in the application cache.

from_path.description: A relative URL. For example, the `from_path` value `/spring` redirects shoppers from the URL `www.example.com/spring`. An asterisk (`*`) at the end of the `from_path` indicates a wildcard. For example, a redirect from `/a/*` matches `/a/`, `/a/b`, and `/a/b/c`.

to_url.description: A relative or absolute URL. For example, the `to_url` value `/summer` redirects shoppers to the URL `www.example.com/summer`.

forward_querystring.description: Some requests contain query string parameters to include in the redirected request. For example, the relative path `/spring-landing-page` can be appended with a query string for analytics tracking, such as `/spring-landing-page?gclid=123`. The `true` value includes query string parameters in the redirect. The `false` value excludes query string parameters from the redirect. The default value is `false`.

forward_wildcard.description: The `true` value automatically includes any path that comes after the wildcard portion of the `from_path` in the `to_url`. For example: if `/a/*` matches `/a/b/c` in the `from_path` and the `to_url` is `/z/`, the redirect URL is `/z/b/c`. The `false` value excludes the wildcard portion. The default value is `false`.

The HTTP status code to be returned in the response. 301 (Moved Permanently) is the recommended and default value. 302 (Found or Moved Temporarily) is another allowable value. For more information about HTTP status codes, see this [status code explainer](https://moz.com/learn/seo/redirection).

SsrRegionEnum.description:
* `us-east-1` - US East (N. Virginia)
* `us-east-2` - US East (Ohio)
* `us-west-1` - US West (N. California)
* `us-west-2` - US West (Oregon)
* `ap-south-1` - Asia Pacific (Mumbai)
* `ap-south-2` - Asia Pacific (Hyderabad)
* `ap-northeast-2` - Asia Pacific (Seoul)
* `ap-southeast-1` - Asia Pacific (Singapore)
* `ap-southeast-2` - Asia Pacific (Sydney)
* `ap-southeast-3` - Asia Pacific (Jakarta)
* `ap-northeast-1` - Asia Pacific (Tokyo)
* `ap-northeast-3` - Asia Pacific (Osaka)
* `ca-central-1` - Canada (Central)
* `eu-central-1` - EU (Frankfurt)
* `eu-central-2` - EU (Zurich)
* `eu-west-1` - EU (Ireland)
* `eu-west-2` - EU (London)
* `eu-west-3` - EU (Paris)
* `eu-north-1` - EU (Stockholm)
* `eu-south-1` - EU (Milan)
* `il-central-1` - Israel (Tel Aviv)
* `me-central-1` - Middle East (UAE)
* `sa-east-1` - South America (Sao Paulo)

StateEnum.description:
* `CREATE_IN_PROGRESS` - Create in Progress
* `PUBLISH_IN_PROGRESS` - Publish in Progress
* `ACTIVE` - Active
* `CREATE_FAILED` - Create Failed
* `PUBLISH_FAILED` - Publish Failed

Basic.description:
A basic authentication scheme for Managed Runtime API endpoints. To make an API request, concatenate your email address and API key separated by a colon (`:`). Base64 encode the concatenated string and include it in the HTTP request Authorization header.

Example:

`Authorization: Basic $B64_ENCODED_VALUE`

BearerToken.description:
A bearer token authentication scheme for Managed Runtime API endpoints. To make an API request, include your API key in the HTTP request Authorization header.

Example:

`Authorization: Bearer $API_KEY`
